Description: Mould-made pottery lamp decorated on the discus with Eros standing cross-legged on a panelled plinth, with a shattered amphora beside him. The angular shoulder is decorated with impressed ovules. At the rear are the remains of a handle, with a vertical handle-ornament decorated with a winged draped Nemesis with a polos and nimbus, holding a balance; beside her is a wheel. Within the base-ring is a central raised point. The nozzle is missing.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (Q2053)
